section.title: Validator and Dictionary
section.para: The Diameter Validator provides message validation in accordance with industry standards. The primary purpose of the Validator is to detect malformed messages, such as an Answer message that contains a Destination-Host Attribute Value Pair (AVP).
The Valdiator is capable of validating multi-leveled, grouped AVPs, excluding the following content types:

The Validator API is designed to perform validation of whole messages with reference to AVP consistency. For future releases, user-initiated validation is planned. In addition, the validator is a JDiameter stack component, therefore it can be used at the application session level.

formalpara.title: Dictionary
formalpara.para: The Dictionary is used by the MUX to create and retrieve correctly configured messages and Attribute Value Pairs (AVPs) such as bit flags and AVP types.

section.para: Because the Diameter dictionary is responsible for setting the parameters and flags, an application does not need to control this information. This results in applications that are more efficient. The dictionary also provides information that can be used for validation purposes.
